studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated safety information to include cerebrovascular accidents as a new safety observation from post-marketing settings.
Added mandatory pulse/heart rate and blood pressure monitoring at every protocol-specified visit.
Added specific dose modification instructions for subjects with chronic hepatic impairment based on Child-Pugh classification.
Broadened the definition of major hemorrhagic events to include any Grade 3+ event or CNS hemorrhage.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To update safety information to align with the ibrutinib Investigatorâ€™s Brochure (IB) regarding cerebrovascular accidents.
To halt the collection of complete response (CR) minimal residual disease (MRD) samples for subjects already having an MRD-negative sample.
Addition of a second interim analysis to mitigate for the potential long interval between the first interim and final analysis.
Minor editorial changes implemented to correct typographical errors and address inconsistencies.

studyChanges.beforeText: Any hemorrhagic event that is Grade 3 or greater in severity or that results in 1 of the following: intraocular bleeding causing loss of vision, the need for a transfusion of 2 or more units of red cells...
studyChanges.afterText: Any treatment-emergent hemorrhagic adverse event of Grade 3 or higher; Any treatment-emergent serious adverse event of bleeding; Any CNS hemorrhage/hematoma of any grade.
studyChanges.summary: Broadened scope of major hemorrhage definition.

studyChanges.beforeText: Hematology values must be within the following limits within 14 days prior to randomization
studyChanges.afterText: Hematology values must be within the following limits:
studyChanges.summary: Removed the specific 14-day timeframe for laboratory parameter eligibility.

studyChanges.afterText: If a dose of study drug is not taken at the scheduled time, it can be taken as soon as possible on the same day with a return to the normal schedule the following day.
studyChanges.summary: Updated missed dose instructions for consistency with product label.
Corrected the short axis measurement for previously involved nodes in CR criteria.

studyChanges.afterText: Footnote j added: vital sign assessments should be recorded in source documents but will not be routinely collected in the eCRF.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified recording requirements for pulse and blood pressure monitoring.
